body.p:
To the Honble -- Bramblette
Governor of the Comlth Ky
Citizens of Carroll County

Your petitioners would respectfully state that on the 24th May 1861 a respite was granted to William Gardner for 12 months on a judgment agst him in favor of the Comlth. We would state that we are well acquanted with Mr Gardner. That there has no indictment found agst him since the judgment in this case and that he has deported himself as a law abiding citizen We believe him entitled to executive clemency and request that the Comwlths part
of said fine may be remitted.

A R Gaunt
R. W. Masterson
Allen Hanks
P. U. Major then C. A.
We recommend that the prayer of the petitioner be granted --

This petition was hand me to hand over to Your Excy while I was a resident of Frankfort and it has escaped memory until the present time. I hope your Excy will excuse my and grant the prayer of the petitioner

Respectfully
Your obed't Ser't
P. U. Major
Nov 20th 1863

Carroll County
Refused
T E Bramlette
63
